for_sales.sales_text:
A Cornish Crabber Mk1 CC3, built 1975, "Hannah of Rock" is the last of only four wooden crabbers ever built. She was used as the mould template for subsequent fibreglass hulls.

Following a stroke last year and four grandchildren it"s time to change to a larger boat. Over nine years of ownership based at Felixstowe Ferry on the River Deben we have enjoyed sailing the surrounding rivers and estuaries with a lifting centerboard able to enter even the Deben at any state of the tide.

During ownership we have made good the hull and all wooden parts which with continued care are good for another nine years. We have fitted a new Nanni Diesel N2.14 10 HP (2012 with less than 100 hours) new mast, new sail (2013), new radio (2016), new wireless wind speed and direction (2017). She has a depth gauge and compass with all the usual kit; fenders, ropes, fire extinguishers, two anchors, auto steering attached to tiller, topsail and jackyard with associated wooden spars, complete stainless steel railing and cables (not fitted). There is a road trailer used to transport the boat from Falmouth, which is no longer road usable.

Presently afloat Bawdsey Quay.

boat.full_description:
The third of only four marine ply Cornish Crabbers, Hannah is the only one known to survive.

When Hannah of Rock was lifted out of the water at the end of 2019 it became apparent that the steel centre board was blown with a large amount of rust and needed repairing/replacing. The rudder bearing male and female parts, which had always been worn, had reached a stage that they would have to be repaired/renewed.

She was bought by Felixstowe Boat Yard for restoration. Once the repairs are done the boat should be a great purchase for someone interested in such a classic Gaff Rig.
boat.name: Hannah of Rock
boat.short_description: Built in ply, Hannah of Rock provided the mould for all subsequent mark 1 Cornish Crabbers.
